action.action-desc: Mr. Rice of South Carolina (for himself and Mr. Kind) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide uniform standards for the use of electronic signatures for third-party disclosure authorizations.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Electronic Signature Standards Act of 2017.

section.header: Uniform standards for the use of electronic signatures for third-party disclosure authorizations
section.text: Paragraph (3) of section 6061(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall publish guidance as appropriate to define and implement any waiver of the signature requirements or any method adopted under paragraph (1).

subparagraph.header: Electronic signatures for third-party disclosure authorizations
subparagraph.text: Not later than 6 months after the date of the enactment of this subparagraph, the Secretary shall publish guidance to establish uniform standards and procedures for the acceptance of practitioner signatures of digital or other electronic form for purposes ofâ€”

clause.text: any request for disclosure of a taxpayer's return or return information under section 6103(c), and
any power of attorney executed by the taxpayer.

subparagraph.text: For purposes of subparagraph (B), the term practitioner means any individual in good standing who is regulated under section 330 of title 31, United States Code.
